documents.document: @evora1907 @aheimert I'm an anomaly in many ways so it's my fault as much as anyone's. started in non research but had poli sci background.. lateraled. stayed way too long after. that world is as old guard and slow to change as any. they have fixed idea of what young are to do in field... often wrong

@evora1907 @aheimert I do also know people about my age in gov that have moved up the $ ladder extremely fast. I guess I can't totally convince myself they did that much more work than I did... but life isn't fair.

@evora1907 @aheimert I agree and there is nuance to everything which is usually missed here at least initially. The DC non profit world in some ways preys on young people convinced they are about to help the world. Comparing a think tank to gov is apples to oranges for sure.

@DavidMRohde Trump has a knack for wedge issues. I am totally with the fed employees and against him but I can sense my comment here was not taken that well by some who've seen it so far... so yeah. Our country's main product is squabbling.

@rlviser yes -- it's not a totally fair comparison. A place like Brookings is almost the opposite (like they have a law against raises hah). some is needing to bounce around to rise now but sometimes sucks to think I could be around 100k per yr instead of waaaaaay less.

@DavidMRohde no I didn't think that. I just assume the media overfocuses on a few places that food is pouring in etc. as some nws folks here have mentioned ... in their towns people don't even know feds work there.
@stormchasernick we're so great it's hard to remember what great is.

@DavidMRohde for sure, although I'm guessing the stories of the giving are more than the actualities. the fed gov is an easy target.. people on both sides can find faults without much effort. but it is still necessary for our way of life.

@aheimert you skipped a whole part after the beginning. ;p
it is true ... I also worked in a field where people were highly educated. I would be embarrassed to share my salary increase over 12 years lol.
@SnarkyEM this is pretty key overall. https://t.co/qWuuFtnGJv

@CogNerd yes most likely although in some senses I think it goes beyond. Every now and then I hear salaries of NWS guys not far out of school.. they start quite low but move up quite quick. I was in the non profit world so it's a bad comparison there I suppose.
@Bscott4293 There is an odd tendency to overprep and underclean after here
RT @Bscott4293: @islivingston they will run out of salt before the next actual storm

"Those are certainly words, though none of them appeared to answer my question." https://t.co/Cd7SLpzNcM

@mattlanza it is silly... people have become uber paranoid on both ends of the spectrum. that said, it's not too hard to imagine a day he was removed from office and decided to tweet his supporters to "save America!" or some such gibberish. low odds high impact event maybe heh.
Another cool thing brought to you by the federal gov you probably take for granted.
@mattlanza yeah it is absurd. it should be a relatively easy answer tho you'd think. it is not their responsibility but they've already given him great leeway and the absurd keeps happening.
It's that time of year to keep this link handy. https://t.co/eElx91o5WB https://t.co/iUt1c1nfNo
We made a big mistake in giving tech bros so much power. https://t.co/gt8DNzzN8J
@ryanhanrahan True we do get into the weeds a bit ;)

@ryanhanrahan maybe most people don't know the difference btween 1.8 inches of ice and 0.25 or even 0.5. too many model maps. ;p i like your highlight of ice threat area what more do you really need at this range other than perhaps a hint it could be significant.

@Indyweather24 the product may have some use to a trained person but to most they just look apocalyptic and almost 2" of ice is pretty unlikely prob. some folks seem to think it should be shared just because it's there.
@ryanhanrahan So TWC is too low? That may be but the other has like a historic ice storm.

Someone will probably get a lot of ice and then people will try to spin out of it but the accumulated freezing rain maps are an example of something the public never needs at this range. https://t.co/8qig4Uxjq9

@ericfisher @mattlanza it was below avg here but not a bad winter. you learn to enjoy everything you get here heh. definitely solid after the flip. they are rather similar.. precip specifics the biggest wildcard in analogs prob.

It wouldn't matter so much if this wasn't just another form of our security theater. The folks they miss are very frequently largely off the radar even though they exhibit tons of signs.

"authorities don't think anyone else was involved in the plot."
Yeah because you invented the crime by acting like you had all sorts of great stuff to give him. The guy might be an idiot, sure...

These stories often sound so fishy. Plenty of examples of people being left to their own that eventually cause trouble but a good chunk of these people never seem to be a real threat until they are tricked by agents. https://t.co/ZhFqCAXUjU

Now a week of below normal temps after 28 days above. Guess we did better snowwise tho. https://t.co/eQBvOvFOUQ
@AsympU I love snow but not cold.. it's a complicated relationship.

@shawnmilrad I’m a bit wishy washy
@mattlanza The one plus of standing for nothing is how easy it to to shift thoughts
DC's normals start rising tomorrow. #springiscoming https://t.co/zUKCaEt4Y7 https://t.co/36JXJC8gdS
@TerpWeather @IrishEagle @stormchas4 Could be I have no confidence. It just seems huge. A good reason to shut coal down if so heh.
And I wonder why I’m not part of the buddy buddy network here.
@rgchauvin @amosmagliocco I honestly didn't even think of that angle.. a legit reason for an emergency. makes sense for sure.
It’s 2015 redux with a side of 2010 and the coldest pattern ever. Euro shows 1.5 inch of ice in 6 hours. There’s never been winter like this.
Omg these pretty colors at d15 are prettier than the others! #snowporn #coldxxx
#wxtwitter is like a weather models site these days.
This admin is trying to bring slave labor back. https://t.co/ipuL485wgh

@antmasiello @ericfisher @jhomenuk @shortstack81 yeah I've been watching end mo a while now and I'm rarely (never) the first so... it also seemed fairly clear the month as a whole would remain active which is never a given in Jan of late.
@amosmagliocco @rgchauvin Agreed

@ericfisher @antmasiello @jhomenuk @shortstack81 I've noticed the long range analogs have fewer historic cold years lately. maybe a blip but cold being too cold at range is the gift that keeps on giving every winter. if that pattern is right it's gonna be chilly tho of course heh.

@antmasiello @ericfisher @jhomenuk @shortstack81 it definitely looks a lot like a Nino for CONUS and surrounds but the amount of waves in flow reminds me of a Nina to some degree. not to mention we've really had a storm like every weekend for months.
@antmasiello @jhomenuk @shortstack81 All the vorts are mine. #dcwinter
@ericfisher @jhomenuk @antmasiello @shortstack81 This does at least feel like a winter folks should be extra careful about storm calls 4-7+ out... at least until stable blocking shows up.
@amosmagliocco @rgchauvin or who deploys the military here for what seems to be on its way to indefinitely. hence the idea a tsa walkout might not be the worst plan at this point.
@jhomenuk @antmasiello @shortstack81 huh yeah good call was just watching the lakes mainly heh.
@metz_chance @BLynch74 this seems relatively likely but it doesn't take much to make a big shift and it would fit into ideas of a nino more than other phases.
RT @aheimert: @islivingston Ideal timing would be the evening Congress goes into recess for the long weekend.
RT @wxdam: @islivingston DCA should do it. Friday afternoon, right when all the senators and congresspeople are scurrying to get home for t…

@epicciuto it's all beyond odd.. does he have dirt on all of them? they'd be viewed pretty favorably by independents and perhaps the left for stepping up. but I think the oddness should perhaps factor in to the level we're willing to take this up to as citizens.

@IrishEagle @stormchas4 Yeah I noticed that “plume” as well. It is right around some of the highest terrain in that area I think (we visit Canaan Valley frequently). Some sort of lenticular like cloud?

Not entirely sure what's going on in WV. @stormchas4 often posts how you can see power plants out there but that seems awful large so must be terrain influence off the mtns? Either way, the other stuff shows up well here. https://t.co/XRPrTDcQ0m
Snapshot https://t.co/Ps1S1gQY1D

Neat local satellite imagery today. Cloud deck moving into the DC area and a lot of what appear to be distrails. Check over WV, southern PA and in the 95 corridor region. https://t.co/FCgSLAWNt2 https://t.co/qVMkbE88RV
@nsj @WxDeFlitch Some excitement is good. Not a ton of professions where everyone is so passionate. I guess it’s partly I listen to the folks who are left totally confused.
@WxDeFlitch Some people are quite obvious in their fishing for shares. It does seem that if you have the right resume many in the biz will look the other way.
I'm trying to imagine the articles about a gov overseas where churches and other groups had to step up to feed gov workers that were not being paid by the leadership.
@jhomenuk @HCFT871 @_NEweather @ForecasterEnten lol. one thing I miss about the weather forums is pages of nam extrapolation during a big event.

It backed off a smidge last night, so oranges returned to parts of the west, but can't recall many images like this one where almost the whole CONUS has below normal 500mb heights. Not even getting into cold specifics, as it'll be cold.. January and weather-map blues. https://t.co/Ijl08DU9pI

@jcolman22 I think a good part is that imagery sells overall here. could type the same msg with no model image and it would get way less interest most of the time prob. that in mind if a forecaster or forecaster adjacent should prob try to keep the wishcasting offline for good of industry.
